snippet: Gains for the insurer, which received the biggest bailout in the financial crisis, were driven by improved performance at its Chartis and SunAmerica units.
abstract: American International Group reports first-quarter net income of $3.2 billion, or $1.71 a share, compared with $1.3 billion, or 31 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter
lead_paragraph: Gains for the insurer, which received the biggest bailout in the financial crisis, were driven by improved performance at its Chartis and SunAmerica units.

headline.seo: A.I.G. Posts Net Income of $3.2 Billion
headline.main: A.I.G. Says Its Earnings Doubled in 1st Quarter
headline.print_headline: A.I.G. Says Its Earnings Doubled In 1st Quarter
